src

Class ProductRegister

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.ProductRegister

  • public class ProductRegister
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents a product register. This class is responsible for handeling all the different products, and have methods to fetch, add, change and remove products for the register.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeDescription(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String description)
      This function changes the description of a product.
      void changePrice(java.lang.String id, int price)
      This function changes the price of a product.
      void createProduct(java.lang.String id, int price, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String brandName, double weight, double length, double height, java.lang.String color, int quantity, int category)
      This function creates a new product and adds it to the product register.
      void decreaseProductInventory(java.lang.String id, int quantity)
      Decrease the quantity of a product by a given amount.
      Product deepCopy(Product product)
      Create a new Product object and pass the old Product object to the constructor.
      Product getProductDeepCopyByID(java.lang.String id)
      It takes a string as input, and returns a product that matches the ID.
      void increaseProductInventory(java.lang.String id, int quantity)
      This function takes a product id and a quantity, and increases the quantity of the product with the given id by the given quantity.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> printAllProducts()
      Return a list of all products in the register, where each product is represented as a string.
      void removeProduct(java.lang.String id)
      Remove the product with the given id from the product register.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> searchByKeywords(java.lang.String keywords)
      It takes a string of keywords, splits them into a list, then filters the product register for products that contain any of the keywords in their description, and returns a deep copy of the filtered list.

      • printAllProducts

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> printAllProducts()
        Return a list of all products in the register, where each product is represented as a string.
        Returns:
        A list of strings.

      • createProduct

        public void createProduct(java.lang.String id,
                          int price,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          java.lang.String brandName,
                          double weight,
                          double length,
                          double height,
                          java.lang.String color,
                          int quantity,
                          int category)
        This function creates a new product and adds it to the product register.
        Parameters:
        id - The product's id.
        price - The price of the product
        description - A string that describes the product.
        brandName - The brand name of the product.
        weight - the weight of the product in kg
        length - The length of the product
        height - The height of the product in cm.
        color - String
        quantity - The amount of the product in stock
        category - 1 = Electronics, 2 = Clothing, 3 = Furniture, 4 = Food, 5 = Other

      • deepCopy

        public Product deepCopy(Product product)
        Create a new Product object and pass the old Product object to the constructor.
        Parameters:
        product - The product to be copied.
        Returns:
        A new Product object with the same values as the original Product object.

      • getProductDeepCopyByID

        public Product getProductDeepCopyByID(java.lang.String id)
        It takes a string as input, and returns a product that matches the ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the product you want to search for.
        Returns:
        A deep copy of the product.

      • searchByKeywords

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> searchByKeywords(java.lang.String keywords)
        It takes a string of keywords, splits them into a list, then filters the product register for products that contain any of the keywords in their description, and returns a deep copy of the filtered list.
        Parameters:
        keywords - a comma-separated list of keywords
        Returns:
        A list of products that match the keywords

      • increaseProductInventory

        public void increaseProductInventory(java.lang.String id,
                                     int quantity)
        This function takes a product id and a quantity, and increases the quantity of the product with the given id by the given quantity.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the product to be updated.
        quantity - The amount to increase the quantity by.

      • decreaseProductInventory

        public void decreaseProductInventory(java.lang.String id,
                                     int quantity)
        Decrease the quantity of a product by a given amount.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the product to be updated.
        quantity - the number of products to be added to the inventory

      • removeProduct
